meanings.definition: A space left at the beginning of a line of text.
meanings.sent1: The indention at the start of the paragraph made it easy to see where it began.
meanings.sent2: She noticed an indention at the beginning of the sentence, indicating a new idea.
meanings.sent3: The indention in the paper looked like a tiny smile, adding character to the page.
meanings.sent4: The indention in the sand resembled a small crater, as if a tiny meteor had landed.
meanings.sent5: The indention in the clay was deep and clear, like a footprint in wet mud.

meanings.definition: A notch or recess in a surface.
meanings.sent1: He felt a small indention on the wooden table, where a previous mark had been made.
meanings.sent2: The indention in the wall was perfect for holding a small decoration.
meanings.sent3: The indention in the cookie made it look like a smiley face, bringing a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The indention in the rock formation created a unique pattern in the cliff.
meanings.sent5: The indention in the pillow was so deep, it seemed like a small cave.

meanings.definition: The act of indenting or the state of being indented.
meanings.sent1: Her indention of the first line in each paragraph made the text more organized.
meanings.sent2: The indention of the metal sheet created a secure connection between the pieces.
meanings.sent3: The indention of the dough before baking gave the cookies a lovely shape.
meanings.sent4: The indention of the key into the lock signaled the beginning of a new adventure.
meanings.sent5: The indention of the stamp on the envelope ensured it would reach its destination.
